root.TEXT:
Record date: 2097-05-15
CCU Admission Note
Name: Booker, Jennifer
MRN: 727 57 14
Date of admission: 5/15/97
Attending: Anaya
PCP: Dr. Mia Tapia (Legacy Center)
Reason for admission to CCU:
45 yo F w/ h/o DM, HTN, hypertriglyceridemia, tobacco use p/w SSCP and inferior STEMI. Treated w/ Reteplase for successful resolution of STE.
HPI:
Pt with above CVD risk factors and HCV developed "10/10" SSCP/pressure accompanied by nausea and diaphoresis while at rest evening of admission at approximately 11 PM. Pain had no radiation to back, jaw, L arm. Pt had no syncope, palpitations, light headedness. EMS activated and initial vitals P 62 BP 124/palp RR 16. Described as pale, dry. STE noted in inferior leads, V4R not elevated. Pt provided w/ ASA, TNG spray and 250 cc bolus.
In ED, T 96.1 P 60 BP 75/45 RR 18. Provided ASA 325, heparin bolus at 5000U and 1000 U/hour, MSO4. STE noted inferiorly. Due to delay at cath lab pt received Reteplase10 units over 2 minutes at about 2 AM, followed by second dose of 10 units 30 mins later. She developed bradycardia to 42 and received atropine 0.5 mg x 1; pulse increased to 60s. EKG monitoring showed resolution of STE in inferior leads. Pt transported to CCU w/ symptomatic relief of pain.
PMH:
Hepatitis C : liver biopsy 12/2093 with chronic hepatitis, stage III/IV, bridging fibrosis, failed interferon.
Hypothyroidism
Hypertension
Bipolar disease
otalgia : possible neuralgia
Diabetes mellitus, most recent Hgb A1c 7.30 6/28/96.
Obsessive compulsive disorder
Medications upon admission:
Synthroid (LEVOTHYROXINE SODIUM) PO QD (175MCG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) x 90 days)
Tegretol (CARBAMAZEPINE) PO TID (100MG TABLET CHEWABLE take 1 Tablet(s)), 2 Tablets QAM, 3 Tablets QPM
Wellbutrin (BUPROPION HCL) PO QD (75MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s))
Ativan (LORAZEPAM) PO TID (0.5MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s))
Ativan (LORAZEPAM) PO QHS (1MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s))
Triazolam PO QHS (0.25MG TABLET take 0.5 -1 Tablet(s)), Must stop PM dose of Ativan as per Dr.Good
Neurontin (GABAPENTIN) PO TID (600MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s)), take 1 1/2 at bedtime
Xalatan (LATANOPROST) 1DROP OU QAM
Flonase (FLUTICASONE NASAL SPRAY) 1-2SPRAY NAS QD
Humulin 70/30 (INSULIN 70/30 (HUMAN)) 20U QPM, 18 U QPM SC BID
Lisinopril PO QD (5MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s))
Timolol MALEATE 0.5% 1DROP OS QPM
Albuterol INHALER 2PUFF INH QID PRN prn
Oxycodone PO 4-5 x per day PRN pain in back, ribs (5MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s)).
Albuterol NEBULIZER 2.5MG NEB Q4-6H , premixed vials
Insulin REGULAR HUMULIN ( Sliding Scale SC)
Allergies:
Aspirin - Unknown; ? GI upset.
Sulfa - Unknown
Codeine - Unknown : tolerates oxycodone
FamHx:
Unknown.
SocHx:
Has involved partner with whom she lives.
Active smoker, 20+ pack years.
Occ EtOH; no cocaine, any illicit drug use.
Physical Exam:
Vitals: P 69 BP 105/65 RR 22 SaO2 98% 2 L NC T 96.3
General: NAD, fully oriented, c/o inspiratory pleuritic pain.
HEENT: PERRL, EOMI, sclerae anicteric. OP moist. JVP 6-7 cm.
Chest: CTA B on ant exam.
COR: Regular, distant, nl S1, S2. No MRG. PMI non-displaced. DP 2+ B.
Abd: +BS, soft, NT, ND no HSM
Extremities: No clubbing, cyanosis, edema. Warm.
Neuro: A + O x 3.
Data
WBC 13.1 H (4.5-11.0) th/cmm
HCT 42.2 (36.0-46.0) %
HGB 14.6 (12.0-16.0) gm/dl
RBC 4.75 (4.00-5.20) mil/cmm
PLT 241 (150-350) th/cumm
MCV 89 (80-100) fl
MCH 30.8 (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc
MCHC 34.7 (31.0-37.0) g/dl
RDW 13.4 (11.5-14.5) %
Superstat PT 13.0 (11.1-13.1) sec
Superstat PT-INR 1.1
PT-INR values are valid only for WARFARIN ANTI-COAG THERAPY.
Superstat APTT 21.0 L (22.1-35.1) sec
DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED
Diff Method Auto
Poly 58 (40-70) %
Lymphs 33 (22-44) %
Monos 5 (4-11) %
EOS 3 (0-8) %
Basos 1 (0-3) %
Absolute Neuts 7.68 (1.8-7.7) th/cmm
Absolute Lymphs 4.26 (1.0-4.8) th/cmm
Absolute Monos 0.70 H (0.2-0.4) th/cmm
Absolute EOS 0.37 H (0.1-0.3) th/cmm
Absolute Basos 0.06 (0.0-0.3) th/cmm
Aniso None (NORMAL)
Hypo None (NORMAL)
Macrocytes None
Microcytes None
Sodium (Stat Lab) 134 L (135-145) mmol/L
Potassium (Stat Lab) 4.6 (3.4-4.8) mmol/L
Chloride (Stat Lab) 105 (100-108) mmol/L
CO2 (Stat Lab) 23.7 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L
BUN (Stat Lab) 12 (8-25) mg/dl
Creatinine (Stat Lab) 0.8 (0.6-1.5) mg/dl
Glucose (Stat Lab) 144 H (70-110) mg/dl
Calcium 9.0 (8.5-10.5) mg/dl
Phosphorus 3.6 (2.6-4.5) mg/dl
Magnesium 1.6 (1.4-2.0) meq/L
Creatine Kinase Isoenzymes 1.5 (0.0-6.9) ng/ml
CPK Isoenzymes Index (0.0-3.5) %
CPK and/or CKMB too low to calculate Relative Index.
Troponin-T <0.01 (0.00-0.09) ng/ml
Creatine Kinase 54 (40-150) U/L
Imaging:
CXR - poor inspiration, low lung volumes w/ soft tissue, mild cardiomegaly, early failure.
EKG:
5/15/97 02:37
Sinus brady w/ rate 50; inferior STE, 1-2 mm; biphasic apical TWI; lateral TWI, likely reciprocal changes; slight LAE.
Assessment/Plan:
45 yo F with multiple medical problems, particularly obesity, tobacco history, DM presenting with significant EKG changes in inferior distribution. Because the cath lab was occupied, ward cardiology opted to forego delay and treated her with Reteplase x 2 with excellent results, including resolution of symptoms and resolution of EKG changes.
1. Ischemia.
Now on plavix, statin.
Has received ASA several times during this evaluation. Allergy is GI upset. Clarify with aim of continuing daily ASA for vascular prophylaxis.
Continue heparin peri-event period.
Needs ACE I for remodeling as well as risk reduction as pt has DM.
She merits further definition of her coronary anatomy by catheterization in 1-2 days. Lysis has risk of restenosis, plus may have additional lesion of borderline significance.
High risk for post-lytic restenosis; follow daily EKG, symptoms, markers.
If pt unwilling to undergo cath, then echo plus stress test for characterization of risk stratification.
2. Pump.
Slightly volume overloaded, can administer lasix 20 IV now.
Echo to evaluate post-event remodeling, define anatomy and physiology.
Advance lopressor as tolerated.
3. DM.
Checking sugars QID. Holding hypoglycemics.
She will require tight control peri-infarct.
Cont medications for glaucoma.
4. Psychiatric.
Pt's out-pt regimen will be maintained during this hospitalization. No indication for psychiatric consult.
5. Hypothyroidism.
Maintain on current dosage of levoxyl w/out checking TFTs during hospitalization.
6. Chronic pain.
Cont neurontin.
Provide low-dose narcotic as previously scheduled on out-pt med list.
7. Prophylaxes.
Nexium; on heparin post-event.
Vincent A. Xayavong
#13828
